definition: to be deeply in (trouble, debt etc)/deep set (eyes)
pitfall/trap/to get stuck/to sink/to cave in/to frame (false charge)/to capture (a city in battle)/to fall (to the enemy)/defect

sentences.english: At the same time, banks in Western Europe are neck-deep in shaky loans to these countries.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，西歐銀行的貸款也深陷新興市場國家。

sentences.english: And now you're knee-deep in two of them.
sentences.chinese: 而現在，你卻深陷在兩樁破產案裏。

sentences.english: It is also head high uplift, and in the eyes, carefully.
sentences.chinese: 它也是頭顱高高隆起，眼眶深陷，背脊縮着。

sentences.english: You may recall Strauss-Kahn's caught up in a sex scandal.
sentences.chinese: 你可以回憶一下，卡恩現在深陷性侵犯醜聞。

sentences.english: Across America, high-end real estate is in a deep funk.
sentences.chinese: 美國各地的高端房產都深陷低迷。

sentences.english: The characteristics of Fire Face are small deep-set eyes prominent upper cheekbones thin lips.
sentences.chinese: “金相臉”的人眼小且深陷，上顴骨突出，嘴脣薄。

sentences.english: In regarding herself as a mother, her remorse festers unchecked.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個母親，我深陷懊悔之中。

sentences.english: I ended up standing in waist-deep water beside the wheelchair, which was stuck in the mud.
sentences.chinese: 結果我站在齊腰深的水裏，身旁輪椅深陷在泥濘中。

sentences.english: From those first moments in Rome we were always madly and powerfully in love.
sentences.chinese: 從在羅馬的那時起，我們瘋狂地深陷愛河。

sentences.english: Do you sometimes feel that you are stuck in a rut?
sentences.chinese: 你是否時常感到深陷瑣事無力自拔？

sentences.english: Eyes deep-set , well apart, almond - shaped, and slightly slanting.
sentences.chinese: 眼睛深陷，呈杏仁型，微微傾斜。

sentences.english: When you’re in three, bring a lot of shovels.
sentences.chinese: 當你深陷三處洞穴的時候，多帶些鏟子。

sentences.english: This is why we're still in this quagmire in Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 正因爲這樣，我們還仍舊深陷伊拉克困境。

sentences.english: High smooth quality is used to carry in eyebrow bone place bright, make eye socket produces deep-set result.
sentences.chinese: 在眉骨處用高光色提亮，使眼窩產生深陷的效果。

sentences.english: When you resist the state you’re in, you perpetuate it.
sentences.chinese: 而一旦抵制這種狀態，你會深陷其間難以自拔。

definition: to sink into/to get caught up in/to land in (a predicament)
to fall deeper and deeper (in debt, in love etc)
to sink into (vice, depravity etc)/to pass into oblivion/downfall/passing
caught in (a bad situation)/to fall into (trap etc)
pitfall/trap/to get stuck/to sink/to cave in/to frame (false charge)/to capture (a city in battle)/to fall (to the enemy)/defect
consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
